conclusion: Solve step-by-step by analyzing the electric field at point A from the two charges.
Positive charge of 2q at one vertex, negative charge of -q at another vertex, point O is the midpoint of the line connecting these charges, point A is another vertex of the cube.
Establish a coordinate system with the origin at the positive charge 2q, side length of the cube is L.
Coordinates: 2q at (0,0,0), -q at (L,L,L), point A at (0,0,L), point O at (L/2, L/2, L/2).
Magnitude of the electric field at point O is E.
Calculate electric field at point A due to both charges and find its magnitude.
Electric field due to 2q at (0,0,0): Distance L, direction along z-axis, magnitude E₁ = k·2q/L².
Electric field due to -q at (L,L,L): Distance √2·L, direction from A to -q, vector components in x and y directions, magnitude E₂ = k·q/(2L²).
Resultant electric field vector at A: E₁ = (0, 0, k·2q/L²), E₂ = (-k·q/(2√2·L), -k·q/(2√2·L), 0).
Resultant field components: E_x = -k·q/(2√2·L), E_y = -k·q/(2√2·L), E_z = k·2q/L².
At point O, field magnitude is E. Field from 2q at distance √3L/2: E₁ = 8k·q/(3L²), field from -q at distance √3L/2: E₂ = 4k·q/(3L²).
E = E₁ + E₂ = 4k·q/L², therefore k·q/L² = E/4.
The magnitude of the electric field strength at point A is E·√17/8.
